question:
Consider the following bodies:
  1. Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB)
  2. National Biodiversity Authority (NBA)
  3. Animal Welfare Board of India
   Which of the above is/are statutory body/bodies?
explanation: The National Biodiversity Authority (NBA) is a statutory autonomous body under the Ministry of Environment and Forests, established in 2003. The Animal Welfare Board of India is a statutory advisory body advising the Government of India on animal welfare laws, and promotes animal welfare in the country of India. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) of India is a statutory organisation under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEF&CC).
